attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"query": "What is SageMaker?", "context": [{"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/integrating-sagemaker.md", "_id": "659b9fdc-f9d5-40d6-a6f1-a752e2b955a4", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/examples-sagemaker.md", "_id": "51986f60-6bcb-41ba-819a-81a53970f66e", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/kubernetes-sagemaker-operators.md", "_id": "cf02ffa6-bee6-4198-927c-ac133b30b6a4", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes

SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy machine learning (ML) models in SageMaker. You can install these SageMaker Operators on your Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line Kubernetes tools such as kubectl. This guide shows how to set up and use the operators to run model training, hyperparameter tuning, or inference (real-time and batch) on SageMaker from a Kubernetes cluster. The procedures and guidelines in this chapter assume that you are familiar with Kubernetes and its basic commands.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "./data/sagemaker_documentation/kubernetes-sagemaker-operators.md", "_id": "408f7b37-4ec2-40b1-8021-3b6972c53f7c", "_collection_name": "sagemaker_documentation_v2"}, "page_content": "it received from SageMaker. The SageMaker controller therefore provides the same information to the developers that they would have received using the AWS SDK.", "type": "Document"}]}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"result": "Sure, I'd be happy to help answer your question based on the provided context!

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning (ML) service provided by AWS. It enables data scientists and developers to build, train, and deploy ML models quickly and easily. With SageMaker, you can access an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy data exploration and analysis, without having to manage servers.

Additionally, SageMaker allows you to associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances, so you can save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using AWS Secrets Manager.

SageMaker also offers SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes, which make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy ML models in SageMaker. These operators can be installed on a Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line tools such as kubectl.

Overall, SageMaker provides a complete end-to-end ML development platform that is fully managed and scalable, allowing you to focus on building and training ML models without having to worry about managing the underlying infrastructure."}

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"output_text": "Sure, I'd be happy to help answer your question based on the provided context!

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning (ML) service provided by AWS. It enables data scientists and developers to build, train, and deploy ML models quickly and easily. With SageMaker, you can access an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy data exploration and analysis, without having to manage servers.

Additionally, SageMaker allows you to associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances, so you can save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using AWS Secrets Manager.

SageMaker also offers SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes, which make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy ML models in SageMaker. These operators can be installed on a Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line tools such as kubectl.

Overall, SageMaker provides a complete end-to-end ML development platform that is fully managed and scalable, allowing you to focus on building and training ML models without having to worry about managing the underlying infrastructure."}

attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"question": "What is SageMaker?", "context": "How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide.

Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog

SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes

SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy machine learning (ML) models in SageMaker. You can install these SageMaker Operators on your Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line Kubernetes tools such as kubectl. This guide shows how to set up and use the operators to run model training, hyperparameter tuning, or inference (real-time and batch) on SageMaker from a Kubernetes cluster. The procedures and guidelines in this chapter assume that you are familiar with Kubernetes and its basic commands.

it received from SageMaker. The SageMaker controller therefore provides the same information to the developers that they would have received using the AWS SDK."}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"text": "Sure, I'd be happy to help answer your question based on the provided context!

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning (ML) service provided by AWS. It enables data scientists and developers to build, train, and deploy ML models quickly and easily. With SageMaker, you can access an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy data exploration and analysis, without having to manage servers.

Additionally, SageMaker allows you to associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances, so you can save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using AWS Secrets Manager.

SageMaker also offers SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes, which make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy ML models in SageMaker. These operators can be installed on a Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line tools such as kubectl.

Overall, SageMaker provides a complete end-to-end ML development platform that is fully managed and scalable, allowing you to focus on building and training ML models without having to worry about managing the underlying infrastructure."}

attributes.text:
Prompt after formatting:
[32;1m[1;3m
<s>[INST]
System: 
You are an AI assistant that helps users with answering queries about documentation. You have access to a large collection of documents 
from AWS documentation, particularly SageMaker and have to answer in details and explain clearly.

User: 
Please answer my question about AWS documentation only based on provided context.


-----------
This is the context:
How Amazon SageMaker uses AWS Secrets Manager

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning service. With SageMaker, data scientists and developers can quickly and easily build and train machine learning models, and then directly deploy them into a production-ready hosted environment. It provides an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy access to your data sources for exploration and analysis, so you don't have to manage servers.

You can associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances to save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using Secrets Manager. For more information, see Associate Git Repositories with Amazon SageMaker Notebook Instances in the Amazon SageMaker Developer Guide.

Working with Amazon SageMaker

Amazon SageMaker is a fully managed service that provides every developer and data scientist with the ability to build, train, and deploy machine learning (ML) models. See the following resources for complete code examples with instructions.

Link to Github

Link to AWS Code Sample Catalog

SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes

SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy machine learning (ML) models in SageMaker. You can install these SageMaker Operators on your Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line Kubernetes tools such as kubectl. This guide shows how to set up and use the operators to run model training, hyperparameter tuning, or inference (real-time and batch) on SageMaker from a Kubernetes cluster. The procedures and guidelines in this chapter assume that you are familiar with Kubernetes and its basic commands.

it received from SageMaker. The SageMaker controller therefore provides the same information to the developers that they would have received using the AWS SDK.

-----------
This is the question:
What is SageMaker?

[/INST]

response:
{"result": "Sure, I'd be happy to help answer your question based on the provided context!

SageMaker is a fully managed machine learning (ML) service provided by AWS. It enables data scientists and developers to build, train, and deploy ML models quickly and easily. With SageMaker, you can access an integrated Jupyter authoring notebook instance for easy data exploration and analysis, without having to manage servers.

Additionally, SageMaker allows you to associate Git repositories with your Jupyter notebook instances, so you can save your notebooks in a source control environment that persists even if you stop or delete your notebook instance. You can manage your private repositories credentials using AWS Secrets Manager.

SageMaker also offers SageMaker Operators for Kubernetes, which make it easier for developers and data scientists using Kubernetes to train, tune, and deploy ML models in SageMaker. These operators can be installed on a Kubernetes cluster in Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) to create SageMaker jobs natively using the Kubernetes API and command-line tools such as kubectl.

Overall, SageMaker provides a complete end-to-end ML development platform that is fully managed and scalable, allowing you to focus on building and training ML models without having to worry about managing the underlying infrastructure."}
